ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became a much more thoughtful writer and learned to craft a collection of essays over time.
Learned how to structure my own time and persevere through writing setbacks
How to write and edit a fairly long creative project within one semester, and work with a writing advisor one on one

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course's introduction to other student writers and practitioners in the field was invaluable, and my meetings with my advisor were incredibly helpful.

Strengths - freedom to write
Weaknesses - didnt few cohesion with cohort and didnt feel like group check-ins were productive

It was great! A full-year option would be nice for the project (I bet everyone would take it!). The ball at the end of the semester was a great way to hear everyone's work, and I appreciated the frequent genre check-ins.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend if the student is serious about writing.

In hindsight, I maybe would have taken another senior seminar and worked on my writing at my own pace. The page count and structure felt somewhat stifling to me, and I ran into a lot more writers block than I normally do.
It's an incredible opportunity- would definitely recommend to any English majors interested in creative writing, even if not professionally
